posts.title: Getting Started with JavaScript
posts.content: JavaScript is a powerful scripting language used to create dynamic and interactive content on the web. It can manipulate the DOM, handle events, and communicate with APIs.
posts.author: Jane Doe

posts.title: Understanding CSS Flexbox
posts.content: Flexbox is a CSS layout module that makes it easy to design flexible and responsive layout structures. It works well for both one-dimensional and two-dimensional layouts.
posts.author: Mark King

posts.title: Building Single Page Applications
posts.content: Single Page Applications (SPAs) dynamically update the page without reloading it. They use JavaScript to control routing, views, and data fetching.
posts.author: Amina Wanjiku

posts.title: Connecting to APIs with Fetch
posts.content: The Fetch API provides a modern way to make network requests. It's promise-based and can be used to retrieve, post, and modify data from RESTful APIs.
posts.author: Brian Njoroge

posts.title: Debugging JavaScript Like a Pro
posts.content: To debug effectively, use browser developer tools. Learn to set breakpoints, inspect variables, and track execution flow to identify bugs quickly.
posts.author: Linet Atieno
